name: dart:io.FileStat

methods.name: modeString
methods.desc:
Returns the mode value as a human-readable string.

The string is in the format "rwxrwxrwx", reflecting the user, group, and world permissions to read, write, and execute the file system object, with "-" replacing the letter for missing permissions. Extra permission bits may be represented by prepending "(suid)", "(guid)", and/or "(sticky)" to the mode string.
methods.example:
Implementation

String modeString() {
  var permissions = mode & 0xFFF;
  var codes = const ['---', '--x', '-w-', '-wx', 'r--', 'r-x', 'rw-', 'rwx'];
  var result = [];
  if ((permissions & 0x800) != 0) result.add("(suid) ");
  if ((permissions & 0x400) != 0) result.add("(guid) ");
  if ((permissions & 0x200) != 0) result.add("(sticky) ");
  result
    ..add(codes[(permissions >> 6) & 0x7])
    ..add(codes[(permissions >> 3) & 0x7])
    ..add(codes[permissions & 0x7]);
  return result.join();
}

methods.name: stat
methods.desc:
Asynchronously calls the operating system's stat() function on path.

Returns a Future which completes with a FileStat object containing the data returned by stat(). If the call fails, completes the future with a FileStat object with .type set to FileSystemEntityType.notFound and the other fields invalid.
methods.example:
Implementation

static Future<FileStat> stat(String path) {
  final IOOverrides overrides = IOOverrides.current;
  if (overrides == null) {
    return _stat(path);
  }
  return overrides.stat(path);
}

methods.name: statSync
methods.desc:
Calls the operating system's stat() function on path.

Returns a FileStat object containing the data returned by stat(). If the call fails, returns a FileStat object with .type set to FileSystemEntityType.notFound and the other fields invalid.
methods.example:
Implementation

static FileStat statSync(String path) {
  final IOOverrides overrides = IOOverrides.current;
  if (overrides == null) {
    return _statSyncInternal(path);
  }
  return overrides.statSync(path);
}

methods.name: toString
methods.desc: Returns a string representation of this object.
methods.example:
Implementation

String toString() => """
FileStat: type $type
        changed $changed
        modified $modified
        accessed $accessed
        mode ${modeString()}
        size $size""";

props.name: accessed
props.desc:
The time of the last access to the data of the file system object.

On Windows platforms, this may have 1 day granularity, and be out of date by an hour.

props.name: changed
props.desc:
The time of the last change to the data or metadata of the file system object.

On Windows platforms, this is instead the file creation time.

props.name: mode
props.desc:
The mode of the file system object.

Permissions are encoded in the lower 16 bits of this number, and can be decoded using the modeString getter.

props.name: modified
props.desc: The time of the last change to the data of the file system object.

props.name: size
props.desc: The size of the file system object.

props.name: type
props.desc:
The type of the object (file, directory, or link).

If the call to stat() fails, the type of the returned object is notFound.

desc: A FileStat object represents the result of calling the POSIX stat() function on a file system object. It is an immutable object, representing the snapshotted values returned by the stat() call.
